alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Colleton; Jasper (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 3:40PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort, Colleton and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 340 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beaufort, Port Royal, Ridgeland, Clarendon, Jasper, Hardeeville, Burton, Shell Point, Laurel Bay, Lemon Island, Beaufort Marine Corps Air Station, Parris Island, Ladys Island, Calawassie Island, Old House, Switzerland, Chesterfield, Edwards Burton Rodgers Bridge, Beaufort Memorial Hospital and United States Naval Hospital.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
